intro: Chrysanthemum zawadzkii subsp. yezoense, commonly known as the Yezo chrysanthemum, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its foliage is usually broad and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
